New Records: England lost their final warm-up game ahead of Euro 2024, a 1-0 defeat to Iceland, which is only their second loss in such a game, the first since 1954.
Key Match Events: Iceland's Jon Thorsteinsson scored the only goal of the game with a low shot through the legs of John Stones to beat second-choice goalkeeper Aaron Ramsdale at the near post.
England were disjointed and lacked cohesion in attack, and were weak in defence when it mattered.
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate's men play their final game ahead of this summer's Euro 2024, which begins with a fixture against Serbia on 16 June.
There was a feeling of anticipation ahead of the clash at Wembley to see what the Three Lions' younger players could produce.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate called the performance 'disjointed and disappointing', adding that 'we didn't show enough character, but I think it's good for us before an international tournament'.
Declan Rice said the result 'wasn't ideal' but that there were 'a lot of positive performances'.
Anthony Gordon said that 'a bit of a lack of quality in the final third let us down' on the evening.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match came a day after England's final 26-man squad was announced.
England have commonly been seen as maybe the favourites for Euro 2024 due to the way a deep squad has grown in talent and experience over eight years.
England's flaws on full display as Wembley defeat sours Euro 2024 departure.
Others: The Three Lions will need some big performances from their important players if they're to banish any worries against Serbia.
The tournament begins with a fixture against Serbia on 16 June.
